intro: Fleischmannia mayana, commonly known as the Mexican flame flower, is a species of flowering plant native to Mexico. It belongs to the Acanthaceae family and is characterized by its striking red-orange tubular flowers. The plant has opposite, ovate leaves with serrated edges, and it thrives in full sun to partial shade. It is often cultivated for its ornamental value in gardens and as a houseplant. Fleischmannia mayana is known for its ability to bloom throughout the year under suitable conditions.
